title: Rear Wheel - Spoke Removal

body.body: Warning - General - Stabilise Motorcycle - including DO NOT support on non integral parts
Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
Failure to follow the advice above could result in serious injury or death.
Do not replace more than two spokes on each wheel. If a wheel requires more than two spokes replacing, the wheel must be rebuilt by a specialist wheel builder.
Do not tighten three or more wheel spoke nipples. If three or more wheel spoke nipples require tightening, the wheel must be rebuilt by a specialist wheel builder.
Incorrectly built wheels will affect traction, stability and control of the motorcycle.
Operation with damaged or defective wheels is dangerous
leading to loss of motorcycle control which could result in serious injury or death.
Remove the Rear Wheel DB4; DBB; DT4; DTB; DTC; DU4; DUB; DUC

metadata.ModelsTaxonomyLink: DBB; DUC; DTB; DUB; DTC; DB4; DU4; DT4

body.body: Rear Brake Disc Remove - D Series except DV DVY DW DVX
Remove the rear brake disc if required (see

body.body: Rear Sprocket Carrier Remove - D Series
Remove the rear sprocket carrier and cush drive if required (see
Rear Sprocket Carrier and Cush Drive - Removal

metadata.ModelsTaxonomyLink: DCB; DBB; DVB; DWB; DUC; DTB; DUB; D34; DTC; DPZ; DCZ; D74; D64; DW4; DX4; DW; DVX; DVY; DV; DD4; DR4; DS4; DU4; DT4; D72; D71; DG4; DSB; DSA; DSX; DS1; DD2; DU3; DT3; DUY; DU; DEX; DF4; DF2; DF; DE2; DE; DP2; DP3; DB; DB2; DBX; DA2; DZ; DZA; DC; DC3; D92; DP4; DC4; DB4; D54; DPA; DP

body.body: Remove the tyre, inner tube and rim band.
Making note of the routing, remove and discard the broken/damaged wheel spoke and wheel spoke nipple.

Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
Failure to follow the advice above could result in serious injury or death.
Do not replace more than two spokes on each wheel. If a wheel requires more than two spokes replacing, the wheel must be rebuilt by a specialist wheel builder.
Do not tighten three or more wheel spoke nipples. If three or more wheel spoke nipples require tightening, the wheel must be rebuilt by a specialist wheel builder.
Incorrectly built wheels will affect traction, stability and control of the motorcycle.
Operation with damaged or defective wheels is dangerous
leading to loss of motorcycle control which could result in serious injury or death.
Perform the following operations:
Rear Wheel - Removal
Remove the rear brake disc if required (see
Rear Brake Disc - Removal
Remove the rear sprocket carrier and cush drive if required (see
Rear Sprocket Carrier and Cush Drive - Removal
Remove the tyre, inner tube and rim band.
Making note of the routing, remove and discard the broken/damaged wheel spoke and wheel spoke nipple.
